description.plain:
American singer-songwriter Colbie Caillat was born on May 28, 1985 in Malibu, California to parents Diane and Ken Caillat, Ken being a music producer and engineer known for his work on several Fleetwood Mac albums.

Growing up in a musical environment, she learned how to play instruments from a very young age, but her inspiration to become a singer came from seeing Lauryn Hill in her as role as Rita Watson in the 1993 film Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit. After she started taking vocals lessons, she met musicians Mikal Blue, and later Jason Reeves, who helped her become a songwriter.

To achieve her dream, she tried to audition for American Idol twice, but was rejected both times. Resilient to give up, she started uploading her songs to social network platform MySpace. When one of her songs, “Bubbly,” started to gain traction to the point of making her one of the most popular unsigned artists on the website, she caught the attention of Republic Records and signed her to their label. With a record deal, she released her debut album, Coco, in July 2007. The album, along with “Bubbly,” earned her great commercial success. The single entered and climbed the charts all over the world, reaching the top five in the U.S. and number one in several countries.

The success of “Bubbly” allowed her to collaborate with other rising stars, including Jason Mraz and Taylor Swift, and release a sophomore album, Breakthrough, in 2009. At the 52nd GRAMMY Awards, she received four nominations, winning two of them: Album of the Year for being featured on Taylor Swift’s Fearless on the track “Breathe,” and Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals for “Lucky”. Since then, she continued releasing studio albums that met high-to-moderate success, including All of You (2011), Christmas in the Sand (2012), and Gypsy Heart (2014).

Gypsy Heart marked her last release with Republic Records. When she presented them her album The Malibu Sessions, it wasn’t well-received by the label, so Caillat decided to part ways from it and release it independently in 2016. Ever since, her musical endeavors have slowed down over the years, and mainly consist of forming Gone West, a band comprising her and her fiancé, and Jason Reeves and his wife. They only released one studio album in 2020, the same year they disbanded.

body.plain:
American singer-songwriter Colbie Caillat was born on May 28, 1985 in Malibu, California to parents Diane and Ken Caillat, Ken being a music producer and engineer known for his work on several Fleetwood Mac albums.

Growing up in a musical environment, she learned how to play instruments from a very young age, but her inspiration to become a singer came from seeing Lauryn Hill in her as role as Rita Watson in the 1993 film Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit. After she started taking vocals lessons, she met musicians Mikal Blue, and later Jason Reeves, who helped her become a songwriter.

To achieve her dream, she tried to audition for American Idol twice, but was rejected both times. Resilient to give up, she started uploading her songs to social network platform MySpace. When one of her songs, “Bubbly,” started to gain traction to the point of making her one of the most popular unsigned artists on the website, she caught the attention of Republic Records and signed her to their label. With a record deal, she released her debut album, Coco, in July 2007. The album, along with “Bubbly,” earned her great commercial success. The single entered and climbed the charts all over the world, reaching the top five in the U.S. and number one in several countries.

The success of “Bubbly” allowed her to collaborate with other rising stars, including Jason Mraz and Taylor Swift, and release a sophomore album, Breakthrough, in 2009. At the 52nd GRAMMY Awards, she received four nominations, winning two of them: Album of the Year for being featured on Taylor Swift’s Fearless on the track “Breathe,” and Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals for “Lucky”. Since then, she continued releasing studio albums that met high-to-moderate success, including All of You (2011), Christmas in the Sand (2012), and Gypsy Heart (2014).

Gypsy Heart marked her last release with Republic Records. When she presented them her album The Malibu Sessions, it wasn’t well-received by the label, so Caillat decided to part ways from it and release it independently in 2016. Ever since, her musical endeavors have slowed down over the years, and mainly consist of forming Gone West, a band comprising her and her fiancé, and Jason Reeves and his wife. They only released one studio album in 2020, the same year they disbanded.

songs.title: Bubbly

description.plain:
“Bubbly” is Colbie Caillat’s lead single from her debut album Coco. It is her most successful single of all time. The track peaked at #5 on the Billboard Hot 100 for 7 weeks in 2007.

Caillat told The View:

I didn’t write “Bubbly” for any [special] guy. I wrote it about the feelings you get when you have a crush on somebody, and when they give you butterflies in your stomach and they just make you smile."

songs.embed_content: Read “Bubbly” by Colbie Caillat on Genius

songs.lyrics:
39 ContributorsBubbly Lyrics[Intro]
Will you count me in?

[Verse 1]
I've been awake for a while now
You've got me feeling like a child now
'Cause every time I see your bubbly face
I get the tingles in a silly place

[Chorus]
It starts in my toes and I crinkle my nose
Wherever it goes, I always know
That you make me smile, please stay for a while now
Just take your time, wherever you go

[Verse 2]
The rain is fallin' on my window pane
But we are hidin' in a safer place
Under covers, stayin' dry and warm
You give me feelings that I adore

[Chorus]
They start in my toes, make me crinkle my nose
Wherever it goes, I always know
That you make me smile, please stay for a while now
Just take your time, wherever you go
You might also like[Bridge]
But what am I gonna say
When you make me feel this way?
I just... mm

[Chorus]
And it starts in my toes, makes me crinkle my nose
Wherever it goes, I always know
That you make me smile, please stay for a while now
Just take your time, wherever you go

[Breakdown]
Ta-da-dam, ta-da, da-dam, ta-da-dam, ta-da-da-da, ta-da-dam
Um-ba, da-da, um-ba, ta-da-da-da, uhm, mm-mmh

[Verse 3]
I've been asleep for a while now
You tuck me in, just like a child now
'Cause every time you hold me in your arms
I'm comfortable enough to feel your warmth

[Chorus]
It starts in my soul and I lose all control
When you kiss my nose, the feeling shows
'Cause you make me smile, baby, just take your time now
Holding me tight
[Outro]
Wherever, wherever, wherever you go
Wherever, wherever, wherever you go
Wherever you go, I always know
'Cause you make me smile, even just for a while31Embed

songs.title: Try

description.plain:
In a slower, piano-driven balled, Colbie Caillat relates the pressures society places on women to look (and be) perfect, while posing a question to the listener: “do you like you?”

“Try” was released as the lead single from Caillat’s album “Gypsy Heart.” The song managed to reach #55 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

songs.embed_content: Read “Try” by Colbie Caillat on Genius

[Refrain]

songs.full_title: Brighter Than the Sun by Colbie Caillat
songs.title: Brighter Than the Sun

description.plain: “Brighter Than the Sun” is a song recorded by American recording artist Colbie Caillat. It was written by Colbie Caillat and Ryan Tedder. The song was released as the second single from her third studio album All of You. The song managed to reach #47 on the Billboard Hot 100 and was certified platinum on August 16th, 2012.
